direction.raw_text: As Heidi digests this, Thumper carefully lines up his shot... The eight ball.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So... which one of you has a pet worm?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Worms, plural.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's so gross.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Talk to him about it, he's got the fetish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, they're for a psych project. A study on memory.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stifling a yawn) Shit, better explain before all the excitement gives me a heart attack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's an experiment with flatworms and a maze. You take a flatworm and run it through the maze until he's memorized it. Then you put a new flatworm in the maze. He's clueless. Banging into walls, getting lost, whatever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thoughtfully) Like Ozzy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ten bucks says he eats it off the floor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You chop up the smart flatworm and feed it to the dumb one and presto, the dumb one suddenly knows the maze inside and out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just by absorbing the first worm into its cellular structure, it gets all of the worm's memories.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thoughtfully) That's probably why Hannibal Lecter's so smart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what's the point?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (setting up the eight) Maybe if I can figure out how the memories of a simple worm function, it'll help me understand the complexities of the human brain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (intrigued) So are you planning on becoming a doctor or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I just don't want to lose my mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !!! The cue ball intentionally jumps the table, rocketing into the pitcher of beer on the Greek's table. They're all soaked with beer and debris. Just as they begin to rise, Thumper smashes the cue stick on the table, WHISTLING innocently (while now brandishing a spear). They sit the fuck down. Kristin, impressed, casually wraps her arm around Thumper's waist. He smiles coolly, it's nothing.

dialogue.raw_text: (to Heidi) I think that's your game.

direction.raw_text: Evan and Heidi, making out, burst through the door and fall on the bed. Evan's shirt is unbuttoned and Heidi strokes his chest. Suddenly Heidi stops and sniffs the air.

direction.raw_text: Evan drunkenly crosses the room, grabs two beers from the mini-fridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heidi takes one. Looks under the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan chugs his beer and sits next to her on the bed and puts his arm around her. Very drunk.

direction.raw_text: Heidi teasingly runs her fingers over his smooth torso.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan stops short.

direction.raw_text: Heidi hands him a book marked "AGE 13". He flips it open to a random place and takes the beer from her hand.

direction.raw_text: Evan takes and finishes her beer and begins reading. As he reads, he seems more and more on the verge of passing out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Color drains from Evan's face as he realizes what he's reading. He looks over at Heidi, who kisses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Evan reads, the world seems to ALMOST IMPERCEPTIBLY VIBRATE around him LIKE A TUNING FORK. His voice becomes distant and SOUNDS ECHO around him like distant memories resurrecting themselves...

dialogue.raw_text: Smells like sex in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thumper had a busy afternoon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're kidding. He's so... big.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Charisma and eyeliner go a long way, I guess. Wanna beer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Most guys tuck their porn under here, but all you have are... comp books.

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah. I've been keeping journals since I was seven.

dialogue.raw_text: (respectfully) Wow... read something.

dialogue.raw_text: No way, I'd be too embarrassed.

dialogue.raw_text: Then keep drinking, worm-boy. You're too uptight.

dialogue.raw_text: Freeze! No "worm-boy". No "Mr. Worm," and no "Worm-Master-General!" Once you get a nickname like that you can't shake it. And I don't want everyone thinking I've got tapeworms coming out of my ass or something, okay?

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing) Deal. Now read me something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (re: her beer) For courage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's like my mind refused to believe what it was seeing. Hearing Crockett make those awful screams... Just writing about it gives me the shivers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, go on...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was like Tommy was possessed or something. There was a hate in his eyes that I couldn't really call human.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - 1995 Evan is THIRTEEN again. The scene begins exactly where Evan's blackout occurred as a child. Tommy has just knocked Kayleigh unconscious with a wooden plank, Lenny is frozen at the sight of Crockett in the fluid-soaked gunny sack. And Evan, seething with rage, stands up with clenched fists and CHARGES Tommy at full speed. Evan looks around, utterly confused by his surroundings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before an answer comes, Tommy smiles at his good fortune and swings the plank, hitting Evan's head. Evan is sent sprawling backwards, his forehead bleeding freely. Tommy knocks Evan hard in the ribs with his boots. Evan writhes in agony, his face against the ground. Lenny moves toward the gunny sack, lifts it and tugs desperately on the rope that traps Crockett inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy spins around and flashes an evil smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As if on cue, Lenny does exactly as he's told. His eyes begin to glaze over. Evan, beaten and bloody, reaches out with his last bit of strength, grabs Tommy's foot and holds on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lenny remains frozen in place. Tommy yanks his leg back, breaking Evan's grip. Evan groans on the ground in a writhing heap. Tommy's voice hitches. His eyes water from pent up frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy smiles viciously at Lenny, traumatized to watch Tommy pick up the lighter fluid and spray a liquid fuse from the campfire to the soaked gunny sack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is going on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't undo the rope!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drop it or I'll slit your mother's throat in her sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got him, Lenny. Help Crockett!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to me good, Evan. There's a million other sisters in the world. You didn't have to fuck with mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: And Evan passes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - 2002 Evan comes to with Heidi slapping him awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heidi rolls her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stands and angrily puts on her jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan doesn't even hear her. After getting his bearings, he grabs his jacket and exits, leaving her dumbfounded.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God! No! No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wake up, idiot. It was just a dream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (freaked out) It didn't feel like a dream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe because they never do. (sarcastic) So Don Juan, you pass out on all your dates?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evan drives...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan, exhausted, finally pulls into Lenny's driveway. Very little has changed in the past seven years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now 20, making a model airplane. He's still overweight and looks like his mother dresses him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is filled with model airplanes. Hundreds of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Lenny's bedroom door. Mrs. Kagan, grayer, fatter, opens the door and escorts Evan inside. She glares at Evan while pretending to be cheerful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lenny looks up to see Evan, his jaw drops.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . KAGAN I've got a surprise for you, Lenny. You'll never guess who's here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Looking around, shocked to see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ALL THE WAY AROUND THE ROOM. Nothing has changed in the past seven years. The same kids' toys, posters and comic books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ALL THE WAY AROUND TO LENNY We see he's working on the model again, in his own world. The window of opportunity for conversation has closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence. Lenny frowns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response. Evan picks up a model airplane from the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan, startled, drops the model on the desk. An epiphany.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lenny stares out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With lightning speed, Lenny jumps from his desk and unexpectedly shoves EVAN IN TO THE WALL. Squadrons of hanging planes crash to the floor. Lenny digs his fingers into Evan's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan is terrified. Then Lenny suddenly moves back and begins working on the model again, his eyes a million miles away. Evan is speechless. The door bursts open. Mrs. Kagan looks at the smashed model airplanes by Evan's feet. Evan ignores her accusing stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When Lenny doesn't respond, Mrs. Kagan hustles Evan back into the hallway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, uh, it's me. Evan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that you're working on? A model?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you look busy, so maybe I should make this quick. I'd totally understand if you didn't want to get into this right now, but that day at the junkyard, could you help me remember what happened? Any details?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I couldn't cut the rope.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (containing excitement) Yeah, good, what else do you remember?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drop it or I'll slit your mother's throat in her sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Christ. It really happened.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What if I can get back all my lost memories with my journals.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Make one peep and I swear it'll be your last, motherfucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, thanks for seeing me, man. I shouldn't have waited so long.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evan pulls a dozen journals from beneath his bed and begins pouring over them. Nearby, Thumper empties a can of hairspray into his Mohawk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He finds something he's looking for, marks the page with a yellow post-it note marked, BLACKOUT and sets the book in a separate pile. As he sets the next journal on the bed, it automatically opens up to a place where the spine was bent. Staring up at him is the message:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You really think he wanted to kill you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All I know is that I might be able to unblock some of my repressed memories.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: will come back for you." Evan looks overcome by guilt. Later that evening:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan has now organized a pile of five journals. He selects an entry, begins reading and suddenly closes the journal. Fear covers his face. He holds one of his hands up and isn't surprised to see it trembling. He opens his journal again and reads out loud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His own words grow reverberant, distant. Furthermore, the walls behind him vibrate, slightly worse than before.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (reading aloud) The last thing I remember before the blackout was holding my hands over Kayleigh's ears... (his voice slowly fades) I think I was more focused on her hands on mine than the mailbox across the street...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HALPERN'S HOME - DAY - 1995 Evan, Kayleigh, Lenny and Tommy, all thirteen, watch the mailbox across the street with intense anticipation. When Evan comes to in this memory, the lit cigarette absently drops from his mouth and nestles into the folds of his shirt, SMOLDERING. The mailbox... tick-tock, tick-tock... Like a staring contest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly a car appears from down the street and slowly pulls into the driveway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe it went out. Should someone check it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, you do that, Lenny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . HALPERN, 24, an attractive young mother, gets out of the car and walks to the mailbox. Across the street, Tommy digs his fingers into the nerves of Lenny's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tommy's words make Evan flinch. From inside the car, a BABY begins to cry. Mrs. Halpern walks back to the car. Evan looks on in horror and suddenly clenches his teeth in pain and silently swipes the front of his shirt, sending the lit cigarette to the ground. He pulls up his shirt revealing a fresh BURN MARK on his stomach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Halpern picks her up and carries her to the house. As the mother unlocks the front door to the house, the kids break into wide smiles of relief. But wait... The mother remembers the mail and carries the baby back to the mailbox. Now Tommy is the only one left still smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The baby fumbles with the mailbox's door handle for a moment -- ANGLE ON KIDS' FACES BOOM!!! The blast is deafening. Evan, Kayleigh and Lenny watch the results in stunned horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan and Kayleigh slowly back away in shock and begin to run a few steps when they realize that Lenny isn't with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lenny doesn't seem to hear, his eyes fixated on the crimson road. Evan and Tommy double back and grab him. They try to make him break out into a run, but Lenny's feet drag limply against the ground. Both Tommy and Evan grab an arm and begin to run with Lenny through the woods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Make one peep and I swear it'll be your last, motherfucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . HALPERN How's my sweet girl? Awww, you need a change, don't you honey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . HALPERN You want to open the door, honey?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon! Run!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lenny? Come on!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my God oh my God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evan comes to. Lurches his body over the bed and vomits. Sounds of squeaky bed springs fill the room. Looking sick and pale, he lifts his shirt to see a NEW SCAR from the cigarette burn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the next bed, Thumper's head, wrapped in a blanket, pops up from above a NAKED GESELA'S waist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan sits upright in bed and begins writing in the margins of the journal.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Christ, man. You wanna clean that up before I lose my appetite here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The lobby is decorated with colorful streamers, balloons, posters and banners announcing PARENTS' WEEKEND. Carefree STUDENTS and their parents carry shopping bags toward the bustling elevators. Evan leans against the side of a pay phone, holding his ear to drawn out the noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's obviously hung up on him. Suddenly, a HAND grabs his shoulder. It's PROFESSOR CARTER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan shrugs and forces a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carter waves to another student and her parents and walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, hello, uh, Mrs. Kagan, this is Evan Treborn. (rolling eyes) I know. I'm sorry about that. But I really need to speak with him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whoa! Didn't mean to scare you, Evan. Just wanted to know how the flatworms project was coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, fine I guess. It's been kind of crazy lately with my mom coming up, so I haven't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know, I know. Who can think of worms when your libido's in full swing, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just don't drop the ball, okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't let you down, Professor Carter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her hair now has gray streaks. As she signs for the bill, she leans over and kisses Evan on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrea's smile fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan tries not to react.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrea shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan nods, but something gnaws beneath the surface.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Please, mom. People will talk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't help it. I'm just so proud of you. You've got the highest grades in all of your classes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did Da -- Jason --- get good grades?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Please. He got straight A's without ever touching a book. That was the one area where his memory never failed him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ma? Did he ever say that he figured out a way to recall a lost memory years after he blacked it out for the first time?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why do you ask?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, it's just weird with him being such a brain and all, I just wondered if he was ever able to remember stuff he'd forgotten.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When he was around your age... almost exactly your age. He said he figured out a trick to remember the past.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I couldn't tell if they were real memories or just phantoms. You know, he might only have thought he actually remembered them...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And then, just before it got so bad that he had to be committed, he said that he could...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? What could he do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it. It's nothing. He was far too sick by then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evan hastily hunts through his journals, tearing up the room looking for a certain book. Thumper, lying on his bed, quietly watches Evan with growing concern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thumper jumps off the bed and snatches the journal away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thumper begins scanning the journal entry. A bitter laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands the journal back to Evan. Evan opens it and begins reading it silently. His hands begin to tremble and he slams the book shut in defeat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (reading aloud) I never wanted to be in the movie anyway and it was cold so I wanted to wear my clothes but Mr. Miller took his shirt off -- THUMPER What the fuck are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shhh! I need quiet for this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you stupid or what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shucks, I dunno. But maybe there's a reason why you've repressed the one day when some old lecher had you in your tighty whities, dammit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, man. I'd think twice about this. You could wake up a lot more fucked up than you are now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evan, looking haggard and frail, wipes the greasy hair from his eyes and punches the accelerator. His teeth are clenched and he hammers his fist on the dashboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan pulls into a parking lot of a country diner. He eyes a piece of paper with an address scrawled on it and gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A run-down greasy spoon. Filled with a number of TOWNIES and TRUCKERS. The place is stale with cigarette smoke and appears decorated in grime motif. Evan is about to enter when he spots Kayleigh coming out of the kitchen with a tray full of food. Kayleigh, now twenty, looks pale and sickly thin. She bangs her hip on the swinging door and an order of food crashes to the floor. Her BOSS stares back in aggravation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kayleigh's face turns beet red as she bends down to clean up the order. She is humiliated and Evan leans back against a pay phone so that she can't see him watching her. As she brings the mess inside the kitchen, a CUSTOMER pinches her ass. Evan closely studies her reaction to the offense. She flinches uncomfortably but then composes a smile for the customer. Evan backs out uncomfortably.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Can we get through one goddamned day without you breaking something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kayleigh struggles with the zipper of a shabby coat as she exits. Evan steps out of the shadows. She's startled at first, but eventually recognizes him. A smile flickers across her face and she allows herself to be hugged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kayleigh nods and they walk down the street. She reaches into her pocket, pulls out a pack of smokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan nods and scrutinizes her face with his next question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her face is betrayed by a slight tick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk in silence for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kayleigh stops walking and crushes her cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan's features shift from inquisitory to tenderness. He steps closer to Kayleigh and softly strokes her face. She flinches at first, but remains in the same spot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kayleigh begins to tremble. Tears flow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves her face away from his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her face collapses and she turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kayleigh runs, stops and turns back to Evan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and runs away. Evan looks sick with guilt.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: God, Evan! I never thought I'd see you again. How've you been?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, comme si, comme ca, you know...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Evan. I don't know. It's been a long time. Fill me in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to State now. Things are going okay. I guess. Mom's good...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (declining) Not since we were kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've stopped a hundred times.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So how's Tommy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (takes a long drag) They kept him in juvy for a few years. Now he works over at Dale's Autobody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You still live with your dad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I emancipated myself when I was fifteen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wow. That must've taken some courage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not if you remember my dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Couldn't you have moved in with your mom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shaking her head) She had a new family. Not enough space for me. Said I should have moved in with her when we were kids. But... whatever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, Kayleigh, the reason I came back to town was to talk to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (brightening) Me? Are you kidding? Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember when I was a kid I had all these blackouts?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, lately some of the memories have begun to come back and I'd kinda like to talk to you about one of them in particular. It'd be a big help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, sure. I'll try to remember. Shoot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When we were kids. Your dad was making a movie. Robin Hood or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cold) What do you want to know, Evan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's just... did he... what happened in the basement?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was a long time ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know, but...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cold) Is that why you came all the way back? To ask a lot of stupid questions about Robin Hood?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, but I think something really bad might've happened to us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there a point to any of this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever happened, it wasn't our fault. You know we couldn't have stopped it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Kayleigh. This may sound like bullshit coming from a guy who hasn't spoken to you in seven years...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you were seven years old and there's nothing you could've done to deserve...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (defeated) Just shut up, Evan. You're wasting your breath.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't hate yourself just because your dad's a twisted freak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you trying to convince, Evan?! You come all the way out here to stir up my shit just because you had a bad memory!? You want me to cry on your shoulder and tell you that everything's all better now? Well fuck you, Evan! Nothing's gonna be all better! Okay?! Nothing ever gets better!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I was so wonderful, Evan, why didn't you ever call me? Why'd you leave me here to rot?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

From an upper tier, even more officers with more rifles. Their barrels sight directly at Evan. Rick steps away, quick to maliciously scoop up Evan's torn journals.

dialogue.raw_text: Shit on my dick or blood on my knife.

direction.raw_text: Evan, walking toward some White Supremacists, flinches whenever the occasional INMATE brushes against him. Evan is completely paranoid, waiting for an inevitable attack. Karl makes himself visible among them, holding a journal. He reads:

direction.raw_text: Disappointed, Evan turns back to Carlos. Holds up his journal entry.

dialogue.raw_text: So when I'm out, I need you to watch my face and hands closely.

direction.raw_text: DAY - 1989 Evan, seven, COMES TO in an old familiar place. WE are back in Mrs. Boswell's first grade class. All of the children draw colorful pictures. Evan sees some paper spindles sitting on Mrs. Boswell's desk. As he heads over to them, Mrs. Boswell firmly grabs his shoulders and steers him back to his own desk.

direction.raw_text: Evan, defeated, looks over at his blank piece of paper. He smiles mischievously, and grabs some colored pencils.

direction.raw_text: Soon enough, an image emerges: Evan holding a knife, stands over a heap of several dead inmates Karl and Rick. When done, he sneaks over to Mrs. Boswell's desk, where the two paper spindles sit. The metal needles reach up and skewer a number of paper notes and messages. Evan looks over to see Mrs. Boswell holding up his drawing, horrified.

direction.raw_text: She looks over in time to see Evan using all of his seven- year old strength to WHIP his hands down toward the spindles! The moment before his palms reach them there's a brief instant where SOUNDSCAPES COLLIDE and the world behind him VIBRATES.

dialogue.raw_text: . BOSWELL No monkey business, Evan. Sit still and finish your drawing.

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S OFFICE - DAY Andrea nervously chews her fingernails as she watches Dr. Redfield post CAT-scan results on the light box. A young nurse pushes Evan, in a wheelchair, into the doctor's office.

dialogue.raw_text: (to Andrea) He's saying it's like forty years worth of new memories have been jammed in my brain since last year. Overload city. 'Sat about the gist of it, doc?

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it's nice seeing you again. But you know, people to see, things to read...

direction.raw_text: Outside the office, Evan inspects Dr. Redfield's KEYS and attached SECURITY CARD and smiles. Evan covertly winds himself through the maze of corridors, careful not to be seen by the staff. He finally sees a wing marked "CRIMINALLY INSANE". Evan looks around to make certain he's not being watched, then uses the security card to open the door. He looks in every room of the wing until he finds -- INT. SUNNYVALE - LENNY'S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Evan unlocks the door and is moved by what he sees. Lenny is strapped onto a metal bed, his arms and legs in tight leather restraints. The dark five o'clock shadow and his malicious grin radiate evil. His black and haunting eyes personify hate and murderous intent. Lenny seems neither surprised or happy to see Evan. That is, if he's aware of Evan's presence at all...

direction.raw_text: Nothing from Lenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still nothing. Not even a glance in his direction. Evan sighs and gives up.

direction.raw_text: Evan turns around to leave.

direction.raw_text: Lenny's eyes seethe with hate.

direction.raw_text: DAY - 1989 Seven-year old Evan comes to during the time he first met his father, Jason. Jason waits patiently for young Evan to finish his sentence.

direction.raw_text: Jason is completely thrown.

direction.raw_text: Jason seems extremely upset to hear Evan say this.

dialogue.raw_text: Wait! I need my belt!

dialogue.raw_text: (overly childlike) Loo loo, skip to my loo. Loo loo, skip to my loo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Loo, loo, skip to my loo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . MILLER Hey kid, don't bother with the belt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Back off, fuckbag!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Amazing. That word never fails to make an impression with you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . MILLER Easy does it, Evan! Don't be a bad boy or I'll tell mommy you were naughty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I'll tell the Child Protective Services about your kiddie porn endeavors. One step closer and I'll shove this up your ass!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . MILLER That's dangerous! You could blow your hands off!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Been there, done that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - 1989 BOOM! The blast is deafening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - 2002 Evan, twenty, wakes up with a bloody nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan gets a new series of QUICK IMAGES and FLASHED FACES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh God, Kayleigh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - 1989 Evan (now seven) is institutionalized before a judge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - 1989-1994 Evan (seven through twelve) GROWS UP in an institution.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S OFFICE - DAY - 1989-1994 Evan undergoes years of therapy under Redfield's care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - 2002 Evan lies in a room, same posters from college adorn the walls. Blood flows freely now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan fights off the pain and looks under his bed for something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His journals are missing! He runs from the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (sobbing uncontrollably) Kayleigh... no! You can't die again! I won't let this happen. I won't!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are they?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S OFFCIE - DAY Evan runs into Dr. Redfield's office just as another patient is leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor looks heartbroken, as if Evan has had a relapse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan looks stunned. Refusing to believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan's eyes roll back and he collapses lifelessly to the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . REDFIELD Hey, Evan. What's the big rush? We don't meet for another hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are my goddamn books?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . REDFIELD Books?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My journals! Where are they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . REDFIELD It kills me to have to go through this again. There are no journals. There never were. It's part of this fantasy world your mind created to cope with the guilt of killing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . REDFIELD Think Evan. You've invented a disease that doesn't exist. Alternate universes with colleges, prisons, paraplegia...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I... I need those books.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . REDFIELD You remind me of your father. He always screamed for a photo album even though he never had one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Photos?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evan lies on a platform and gets another series of CAT-scans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan, no longer incapacitated, stares out the window into the darkness. Alone. Trapped. Hopeless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S OFFICE - DAY Later that day, Dr. Redfield posts the new CAT-scan slides on the light box and shudders when he sees the results. Andrea looks on anxiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrea, biting her nails, is unable to conceal her fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrea begins to break down in tears. Evan secretly listens in from the hallway. His gaunt face looks deep in thought. He takes a breath and enters the lab, making sure not to look directly at his weeping mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrea wipes tears away, nodding in advance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . REDFIELD Jesus, no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No dances, just tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . REDFIELD (devastated) The hemorrhaging... the neural damage is irreparable. I'm frankly surprised he still has use of his motor functions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Mom, didja remember to bring those goofy old home movies we used to make?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S CORRIDOR - NIGHT Evan sees no one is watching him in the institution corridor as he throws his weight into the door of the doctor's office, breaking it open. Sporadically, severe VIBRATIONS invade Evan's environment, threatening to distract him from his mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S OFFICE - NIGHT Evan enters the office and tears the file cabinets apart, looking for something. His nose bleeds profusely and he repeatedly wipes the blood off his face with irritation. Evan sees a cardboard marked TREBORN, E. Grabs it and hides under the doctor's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S CORRIDOR - CONTINUOUS FLASHLIGHT BEAMS stab through the darkened corridor hunting for him. An ALARM SOUNDS. GUARDS are shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Evan, under the doctor's desk, grabs some paper and begins writing in shorthand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, the world flutters as if it were attached to a paint- shaker. He takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fatigue overwhelms him, but he continues writing...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If anyone finds this, then I guess my plan didn't work and I'm already dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I -- I can just go back to the beginning of all this, I might be able to save her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S CORRIDOR - CONTINUOUS Dr. Redfield catches up with the rest of the guards.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . REDFIELD He's not in his room. Search the grounds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REDFIELD'S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS The cardboard box is overturned. Evan finishes threading a SUPER-8 film projector and turns it on. Careful not to let any light spill against the wall, Evan projects it at the underside of the desk. We see familiar home movie footage from his childhood: Lenny, 5, has a birthday party. Kayleigh is there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Getting lost in the memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of CHILDREN'S PARTY bleed into Evan's reality. The world SHUDDERS UNCONTROLLABLY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - 1987 Evan, 5, comes to at a birthday party. He's unexpectedly gently prodded forward by Andrea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan slowly approaches Kayleigh, only five. She smiles bashfully at him. An old memory comes back to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan slowly looks around the yard, taking in the reality of this distant memory. He even inhales the aroma of the place. Savoring the moment. He locks eyes with Kayleigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's time. Evan leans over to Kayleigh as if he's about to kiss her. Then whispers in her ear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kayleigh reacts predictably. Bursting into tears and runs into Kayleigh's mother's arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan ignores them. He can't take his eyes off Kayleigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes well up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Go on, Evan. Introduce yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) When my folks split, they gave me and Tommy a choice who we wanted to live with. I couldn't stand my dad, but I knew if I lived with my mom, I'd never see you again...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) He's not usually this shy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate you. If you ever come near me again, I'll kill you and your whole family.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you say to her? What happened?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: DAY - 2002 Evan wakes up with a bloody nose. He grabs a pillow and covers his head with it as a flood of memories seizes him. Lenny (looking fit) grabs a towel from atop an award-winning flatworms project and hands it to Evan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan groans and shakes his head "no". He rides out the pain like a seasoned pro. When it finally subsides, he lowers the pillow and smiles feebly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lenny nods, still concerned.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) You alright? Should I call the doctor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll think I'll be alright this time. (a new hope) I really do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Evan opens the door to a concrete room with a large furnace. He and Lenny carry cardboard boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evan nods. They silently dump tons of journals into the fire. Evan steps outside and returns with a box of home movies, photo albums, old report cards, etc. In they go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You sure about this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ON Burning journals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: DAY - 2010 Evan, a suit now, walks down a city street cradling a cell phone to his ear.
direction.name: direction
